action: I want to safely save, search, and share business documents such as internal materials, contracts, specifications, and reports
reason: To centrally manage information and increase business efficiency while preventing mis-sending and data leakage
acceptance_criteria: File upload is only executable by authenticated users.
Upload permissions are controlled based on roles.
File IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
File names must be within 255 characters.
File names are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Supported extensions are controllable from the management screen.
Dangerous extensions (.exe, .js, .bat, etc.) are strictly rejected.
A maximum file size limit is configurable.
Uploaded files are stored only if they pass a virus scan.
Files are stored in encrypted storage.
Storage paths cannot be directly referenced from outside.
File downloads are only possible after an authorization check.
Download URLs are issued as temporary signed URLs.
An expiration time is set for the URLs.
Access is prohibited for expired URLs.
Owner information of the file is stored.
Access rights (View/Edit/Delete) can be configured for files.
Users without permissions cannot view the files.
Folder hierarchical structures can be created.
Folder name is a mandatory input.
Check for existing files under the folder is performed upon folder deletion.
A file search function exists.
Search is possible by file name, tags, and creator.
Search is executed via a full-text search engine.
Upload date and time are automatically recorded.
An updated date and time field must exist.
File versioning is performed during file updates.
Old versions are retained as history.
Restoration from version history is possible.
File deletion is a logical delete.
Deletion operations are restricted to authorized users.
Audit logs are stored upon deletion.
Operation logs include User ID, operation type, and timestamp.
Operation logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Concurrent updates trigger conflict detection via optimistic locking.
Updates fail if there is a version mismatch.
The same validation applies to operations via API.
Internal storage paths are not included in responses.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
CSRF countermeasures are enabled.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
File download logs are stored.
Large files support multipart (split) upload.
Resuming is possible if an upload is interrupted.
Previewable files (PDF, images, etc.) support browser display.
Authorization checks are performed during previews.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Target response time is within 500ms (for metadata processing).
